column4: Is there a way to configure Ubuntu such that it doesn't ask me whether or not to restart certain services during a distribution upgrade started via the GUI?
My upgrade windows says there is about 1 day and one hour (!) remaining.
Is there some software which records my desktop and audio, but also actually works (as opposed to recordmydesktop)?
recordmydesktop works fine for me. But you have to configure it.
what parts are you talking about?
I am talking about basic things like tearing, etc.
i.e., the quality stinks.
you have to make it record entire frames and so forth.
by default it won't record the entire frames, so it won't work properly in 3D desktop environments like Unity.
I would think that something that is distributed for Ubuntu (which has millions of installations) should you know... work in the default configuration.
Ubuntu shouldn't even distribute such bad applications.

it's not because it's a bad program, it's because it's one of those 'not officially supported, but included' programs. For such programs, you're expected to know how to use the program before downloading it, and if you don't, you can always look online for more information.
no, if people decide to send out crap to consumers, it's their problem.
complain to Canonical.
we aren't consumers. We aren't buying anything. If you bought official (over the phone) support from canonical, THEN you can complain. Until then, you aren't a consumer.
I guess that means RedHat and Microsoft both already lost. They both need support.
and indeed they did.
Microsoft is losing big time as we speak.
in fact, you could go so far as to say that every OS in existence has lost. EVERY operating system needs support.
you don't know what you're talking about, so if you aren't asking an Ubuntu related support question, you may not want to keep talking.
uhm, yes, I do know what I am talking about.\
who are you to say that I don't?
that's important because..?
Unity works as a compiz plugin. To restart it, run compiz --replace.
